meanings.definition: Meticals (noun): The basic monetary unit of Mozambique.
meanings.sent1: In Mozambique, you can buy many things with just a few meticals.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for meticals at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The meticals in my pocket jingled happily as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her savings were like a pile of meticals, growing slowly over time.
meanings.sent5: The shiny meticals sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: Meticals (adjective): Relating to or denoting the currency of Mozambique.
meanings.sent1: The meticals coins were beautifully designed with Mozambican symbols.
meanings.sent2: She paid for her meal with meticals instead of a credit card.
meanings.sent3: The colorful meticals notes brightened up his dull wallet.
meanings.sent4: The value of the meticals currency fluctuated with the market.
meanings.sent5: The shop only accepted payment in meticals, not in any other currency.
